trans-unit.source: Plain Text Passwords and Domain Users
trans-unit.target: Plain Text Passwords and Domain Users

trans-unit.source: DSC configurations containing a credential without encryption will generate an error messages about plain text passwords.
trans-unit.target: DSC configurations containing a credential without encryption will generate an error messages about plain text passwords.

trans-unit.source: Also, DSC will generate a warning when using domain credentials.
trans-unit.target: Also, DSC will generate a warning when using domain credentials.

trans-unit.source: To suppress these error and warning messages use the DSC configuration data keywords:
trans-unit.target: To suppress these error and warning messages use the DSC configuration data keywords:

trans-unit.source: PsDscAllowPlainTextPassword
trans-unit.target: PsDscAllowPlainTextPassword

trans-unit.source: Handling Credentials in DSC
trans-unit.target: Handling Credentials in DSC

trans-unit.source: DSC configuration resources run as Local System by default.
trans-unit.target: DSC configuration resources run as Local System by default.

trans-unit.source: However, some resources need a credential, for example when the Package resource needs to install software under a specific user account.
trans-unit.target: However, some resources need a credential, for example when the Package resource needs to install software under a specific user account.

trans-unit.source: Earlier resources used a hard-coded Credential property name to handle this.
trans-unit.target: Earlier resources used a hard-coded Credential property name to handle this.

trans-unit.source: WMF 5.0 added an automatic PsDscRunAsCredential property for all resources.
trans-unit.target: WMF 5.0 added an automatic PsDscRunAsCredential property for all resources.

trans-unit.source: Newer resources and custom resources can use this automatic property instead of creating their own property for credentials.
trans-unit.target: Newer resources and custom resources can use this automatic property instead of creating their own property for credentials.

trans-unit.source: Note that the design of some resources are to use multiple credentials for a specific reason, and they will have their own credential properties.
trans-unit.target: Note that the design of some resources are to use multiple credentials for a specific reason, and they will have their own credential properties.

trans-unit.source: To find the available credential properties on a resource use either Get-DscResource -Name ResourceName -Syntax or the Intellisense in the ISE (CTRL+SPACE).
trans-unit.target: To find the available credential properties on a resource use either Get-DscResource -Name ResourceName -Syntax or the Intellisense in the ISE (CTRL+SPACE).

trans-unit.source: This example uses a Group resource from the PSDesiredStateConfiguration built-in DSC resource module.
trans-unit.target: This example uses a Group resource from the PSDesiredStateConfiguration built-in DSC resource module.

trans-unit.source: It can create local groups and add or remove members.
trans-unit.target: It can create local groups and add or remove members.

trans-unit.source: It accepts both the Credential property and the automatic PsDscRunAsCredential property.
trans-unit.target: It accepts both the Credential property and the automatic PsDscRunAsCredential property.

trans-unit.source: However, the resource only uses the Credential property.
trans-unit.target: However, the resource only uses the Credential property.

trans-unit.source: Read more about PsDscRunAsCredential in the WMF Release Notes.
trans-unit.target: Read more about PsDscRunAsCredential in the WMF Release Notes.

trans-unit.source: Example: The Group resource Credential property
trans-unit.target: Example: The Group resource Credential property

trans-unit.source: DSC runs under Local System, so it already has permissions to change local users and groups.
trans-unit.target: DSC runs under Local System, so it already has permissions to change local users and groups.

trans-unit.source: If the member added is a local account, then no credential is necessary.
trans-unit.target: If the member added is a local account, then no credential is necessary.

trans-unit.source: If the Group resource adds a domain account to the local group, then a credential is necessary.
trans-unit.target: If the Group resource adds a domain account to the local group, then a credential is necessary.

trans-unit.source: Anonymous queries to Active Directory are not allowed.
trans-unit.target: Anonymous queries to Active Directory are not allowed.

trans-unit.source: The Credential property of the Group resource is the domain account used to query Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: The Credential property of the Group resource is the domain account used to query Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: For most purposes this could be a generic user account, because by default users can read most of the objects in Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: For most purposes this could be a generic user account, because by default users can read most of the objects in Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: Domain Credentials
trans-unit.target: Domain Credentials

trans-unit.source: Running the example configuration script again (with or without encryption), still generates the warning that using a domain account for a credential is not recommended.
trans-unit.target: Running the example configuration script again (with or without encryption), still generates the warning that using a domain account for a credential is not recommended.

trans-unit.source: Using a local account eliminates potential exposure of domain credentials that could be used on other servers.
trans-unit.target: Using a local account eliminates potential exposure of domain credentials that could be used on other servers.

trans-unit.source: When using credentials with DSC resources, prefer a local account over a domain account when possible.
trans-unit.target: When using credentials with DSC resources, prefer a local account over a domain account when possible.

trans-unit.source: If there is a '\' or '@' in the Username property of the credential, then DSC will treat it as a domain account.
trans-unit.target: If there is a '\' or '@' in the Username property of the credential, then DSC will treat it as a domain account.

trans-unit.source: There is an exception for "localhost", "127.0.0.1", and "::1" in the domain portion of the user name.
trans-unit.target: There is an exception for "localhost", "127.0.0.1", and "::1" in the domain portion of the user name.
